definitions.definition: crush or squeeze (something) with force so that it becomes flat, soft, or out of shape.
examples: wash and squash the cans for the recycling bin

definitions.definition: squeeze or force (someone or something) into a small or restricted space.
examples: she squashed some of her clothes inside the bag
synonyms: press "she squashed her clothes inside the bag"

definitions.definition: make one's way into a small or restricted space.
examples: I squashed into the middle of the crowd

definitions.definition: suppress, stifle, or subdue (a feeling, conjecture, or action).
examples: the mournful sound did nothing to squash her high spirits
the proposal was immediately squashed by the Historical Society
synonyms: put the lid on; Moreinformalput the kibosh on

definitions.definition: a state of being squeezed or forced into a small or restricted space.
examples: it was a tight squash but he didn't seem to mind

definitions.definition: a concentrated liquid made from fruit juice and sugar, which is diluted to make a drink.
a game in which two players use rackets to hit a small, soft rubber ball against the walls of a closed court.
a preparation of softened tissue that has been made thin for microscopic examination by gently compressing or tapping it.
an edible gourd, the flesh of which may be cooked and eaten as a vegetable.
examples: acorn squash, butternut squash, crookneck squash, Hubbard squash, scallop squash, spaghetti squash, summer squash, winter squash, zucchini, pumpkin, (vegetable) marrow a side order of steamed squash

definitions.definition: the trailing plant of the gourd family that produces this fruit.
